articles.title: Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Machine Plant
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Machine Plant
Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to the Sinhung Machine Plant.
					 Being briefed on the prospect of the production at the plant, he went round various workshops to acquaint himself in detail with its technological updating and production there. 
					
					 Learning in detail about the mechanism, capacity and principle of operation of newly made machines, he was greatly satisfied to know that the officials, workers and technicians of the plant built a lot of modern machines conducive to the building of an economic power by pooling their creative wisdom.
					
					 He highly appreciated the successes made by the workers of the plant in the past, noting that they manufactured a lot of modern machines for various fields of the national economy, making great contribution to the cause of building a thriving socialist nation. 
					
					 He met Pak Chun Nam and Pak Chun Sun, twin sisters, whom he had met in the worksite more than two decades ago, and kindly asked about their work and life. He praised them for having worked hard with fervent enthusiasm and patriotic devotion for the prosperity of the country up to this date since their girlhood.
					
					  He was very pleased to hear from leading officials that everything was going well at the plant largely thanks to the devoted efforts of the members of the guidance group taking upon themselves the important part of its task, sharing weal and woe with workers in the work sites. Our officials should become fighters who not only support the Party's policies but devotedly implement them in practice, he noted, setting forth the tasks to be fulfilled by the plant. 
					
					 The most important task facing the plant is to dynamically conduct the work for rapidly boosting the manufacture of new products, he added.
					
					 Earnestly calling on the plant to continue channeling great efforts into the supply service for the workers, bearing deep in mind the instruction of President Kim Il Sung that supply service precisely means a political work, he took benevolent measures for the workers of the plant.
					
					 He ardently called upon the workers to make every moment of their life rewarding in the era of great surge by working the way the President did. He said: The President carried out every job with a noble will and great ideal. He was a possessor of such indomitable spirit as carrying out under any circumstances with strong pluck and full of optimism whatever others considered impossible. He was bold enough to create everything that shook the world. He did everything in such a revolutionary work style that it might be impeccable in all aspects to enable posterity to benefit from it. 
					
					 He expressed great expectation and belief that the workers of the plant would play a vanguard role in the building of a thriving socialist nation in the future, too.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Ki Nam and Hong Sok Hyong, members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, 
					
					Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su, department directors of the NDC, and Kwak Pom Gi, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK.

articles.title: Message to Chairman of S. Korean Red Cross
articles.content:
Message to President of S. Korean Red Cross
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Central Committee of the Red Cross Society of the DPRK sent a message to the president of the south Korean Red Cross on Tuesday.
					 The message said that the DPRK proposed north-south dialogue including the authorities' talks in the joint statement of the government, political parties and organizations, a statement of the spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea and an appeal of the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea. There is neither reason nor conditions for the Red Cross organizations of both sides to fail to sit at a negotiating table now that the north-south high-level military talks are to open thanks to the magnanimous and positive proposal made by the Korean People's Army, the message added.
					
					 Expressing regret at the south Korean Red Cross for having not yet responded to the DPRK's proposal for holding the Red Cross talks in Munsan on Feb. 1, the message called for discussing the date of talks again and opening them at the earliest possible date.
					
					 It expressed expectation that the south Korean Red Cross would seek the earliest negotiated settlement of humanitarian issues between the north and the south in response to the compatriotic decision made by the DPRK and measures taken by it out of good faith so as to ensure the restart of reunion of separated families and relatives from upcoming spring.

articles.title: DPRK Termed World's Major Seaweeds Cultivator
articles.content:
DPRK Termed World's Major Seaweeds Cultivator
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The UN Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) has put the DPRK on the list of the world's major seaweeds cultivation nations.
					 In the "white paper on world seafood breeding" issued on Monday, FAO said the DPRK produced about 440,000 tons of seaweeds including laver, brown seaweed and tangle in 2008, ranking sixth in the world.
					
					 The DPRK has cultivated seaweeds in an extensive way, while concentrating its effort on the improvement of the people's living standard.

articles.title: New Year Reception Given for Chinese Embassy Officials
articles.content:
New Year Reception Given for Chinese Embassy Officials
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The International Affairs Department of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea hosted a reception for staff members of the Chinese embassy here at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel on Tuesday on the occasion of the New Year.
					 Present on invitation were Ambassador Liu Hongcai and staff members of the Chinese embassy.
					
					 Secretary of the C.C., the WPK Kim Yong Il and Vice-Director Kim Song Nam and other officials of its International Affairs Department were on hand.
					
					 Kim Yong Il in his speech said that 2010 was a significant year when the flower garden of traditional DPRK-China friendship came into full bloom under the deep care of the top leaders of the two parties and the two countries.
					
					He recalled that General Secretary Kim Jong Il received the Chinese ambassador and his embassy officials several times last year.
					
					 He heartily wished the Chinese party and people greater success in their work to build a harmonious society with the scientific outlook on development.
					
					 He stressed that the DPRK would make all efforts to glorify and boost the DPRK-China friendship as intended by the top leaders of the two parties and the two counties this year, too.
					
					 Liu Hongcai in his speech said that 2010 was the significant year in developing the Sino-DPRK relations, adding that the exchange and cooperation between the two countries were briskly conducted in various fields.
					
					 Noting that General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited  China twice last year, he was pleased that through visits of high-level delegations the friendly relations between the two parties and the two countries were further developed.
					
					 Noting that 2011 is an important year in developing the Sino-DPRK relations, he said that China would strive to carve out more beautiful future of the relations between the two parties and the two countries.
					
					 He sincerely hoped that the Korean people would register new successes by bringing about a decisive turn in building a thriving nation in response to the joint New Year editorial.

articles.title: Russian Ambassador Hosts Friendship Meeting
articles.content:
Russian Ambassador Hosts Friendship Meeting
						
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Valery Sukhinin, Russian Ambassador to the DPRK, Tuesday hosted a New Year friendship meeting with officials of the Pyongyang City People's Committee at his embassy. 
					 Present there on invitation were Chairman Ryang Man Gil and other officials of the Committee. 
					
					 Staff members of the Russian embassy were on hand. 
					
					 After speeches the participants talked to each other about the need to develop the DPRK-Russia relations of friendship.

articles.title: Congratulations from Chinese Organizations
articles.content:
Congratulations from Chinese Organizations
Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a congratulatory letter and gift on the occasion of his birthday. They were presented in the joint name of the China Association for International Friendly Contact and the Beijing Association for International Friendly Contact.
					 They were handed to Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, by Li Xiaohua, vice-president of the China Association, on January 29.

articles.title: Congratulations from Chinese
articles.content:
Congratulations from Chinese
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a congratulatory letter and a gift from families of those related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle in China on the occasion of his birthday.
					 Zhou Wei, director of the Beijing Association for International Friendly Contact, handed the letter and gift to Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, on Jan. 29, on behalf of the families.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Observed
Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A national meeting took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday to mark the 30th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's work "On Improving Quality Control".
					 Present there were Premier of the Cabinet Choe Yong Rim, Vice-Premiers Jon Ha Chol and Jo Pyong Ju, officials of ministries and national institutions and officials in the field of quality control.
					
					 The work, published on February 2, Juche 70 (1981), gives perfect exposition of theoretical and practical issues arising in displaying the advantages and vitality of the Korean-style quality control system.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks and ways for intensifying the work for quality control, including problems of enhancing the authority and function of the state quality control organizations, establishing the strict discipline and order in their work and building up the ranks of quality control personnel.
					
					 At the meeting its participants heard the recorded speech "On Improving Quality Control" made by Kim Il Sung at a national conference of quality control workers.
					
					 Choe Hui Jong, department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, made a report.
					
					 The reporter said the work is an important guideline that should be always held fast to in improving the quality control work as required by the developing reality.
					
					 The reporter noted that Kim Il Sung wisely led the quality control work so that it could contribute to promoting the development of the national economy and improving the people's standard of material and cultural living.
					
					 His exploits for the development of the quality control work have been glorified by leader Kim Jong Il, the reporter said, adding:
					
					 Under his wise leadership, great progress has been made in the standardization and the quality of products improved in various fields of the national economy in recent years. Thus the nation's quality control work has developed onto a new higher stage.
					
					 The reporter underlined the need for all the officials to intensify the quality control work and thus make positive contribution to the improvement of the people's living standard and the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation true to the leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Model in Energy Saving
articles.content:
Model in Energy Saving 
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Huichon Ryonha General Machine Plant has become a model in saving energy.
					 Its 12-layer ceiling has been replaced by a two-layer insulating ceiling.
					
					 Its walls have also been built with lagging materials to boost the heat-preserving effect.
					
					 The plant succeeded in establishing an air-conditioning system by use of underground water, thus consuming just one twentieth of the energy used in the past. This is enough to provide temperature convenient for work and necessary for ensuring precision in assembling. 
					
					 In winter 10-15 degrees centigrade underground water is pumped up and thermo-compressed up to 40-50 degrees centigrade to heat the worksites.
					
					 In summer underground water is used for cooling them.
					
					 This environmentally friendly plant manufactures CNC machine-tools for factories in various fields.

articles.title: Three-phase Rotary Dressing Machine Developed
articles.content:
Three-phase Rotary Dressing Machine Developed 
						
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Ore Dressing Engineering Institute of the State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK developed an efficient three-phase rotary dressing machine.
					 This machine is used for basic and preliminary dressing, making it possible to significantly raise the quality of concentrated ore and the ore dressing rate.
					
					 The researchers conducted experiments which led to optimizing the integral value of the factors which have a decisive impact on dressing rate such as diameter and angles of rotary and fast pressure on ore. In this course they succeeded in completing a design for the above-said dressing machine.
					
					 The introduction of this machine to the process of magnesium hydroxide confirmed that its distribution and dressing rate is about 5 to 10 percent higher than that of ordinary rotary dressing machine.
					
					 This machine is used for distributing and dressing all crushed minerals as it guarantees maximum dressing rate in the preliminary dressing process.

articles.title: Hackneyed Phrase Incompatible with Public Sentiments
articles.content:
Hackneyed Phrase Incompatible with Public Sentiments
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Japanese foreign minister, Seiji Maehara, on January 29 underscored the need to keep U.S. military bases in Japan.
					 In his lecture on the Futenma base he said, "Such security circumstances surrounding Japan as the north Korean situation are raising the tension."
					
					 His remark is too hackneyed to explain the raison d'etre of U.S. military bases in Futenma and other areas of Japan for score of years.
					
					 Japan is keeping U.S. forces in its territory as the country deems it a shortcut to realizing its militarization.
					
					 It is evidenced by a big share of the cost Japan has taken every year for U.S. forces upkeep.
					
					 From 1978 onward, Japan has born the cost for water and electricity supply, heating and drills for the Japan-based U.S. forces in the name of "sympathy budget". Japan's share of the cost for keeping the U.S. military presence in Japan has snowballed, the figure in 1994 being 40 times that in the first period. 
					
					 Japan's share has reached billions of U.S. dollars, or five times the total share of nine European countries, including Germany, Britain, Belgium, France and Spain.
					
					 The U.S. Defense Department has appreciated Japan's big donation as "an example to be followed by other allies".
					
					The Japanese authorities have given no heed to tremendous damages of local people by the U.S. forces' extraterritorial practice, crimes and environmental degradation.
					
					 Japanese public sentiments regarding the U.S. military presence in Japan are getting worse with demand for the abolition of the U.S. installations growing stronger.
					
					 Backed by such public sentiments, the Democratic Party could defeat the Liberal Democratic Party in general election and came to power. 
					
					 It is as good as going against public sentiments for the Japanese politicians to call for keeping the U.S. military presence in Japan.

articles.title: Japan Accused of Whale Hunting
articles.content:
Japan Accused of Whale Hunting 
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Japan has drawn worldwide criticism for its illegal hunting of whales.
					 Japanese boats have continued whaling in the Pacific, Indian and Atlantic Oceans.
					
					In recent years, 1,000 Japanese boats with at least 100,000 crewmen have engaged in whale fishing in the Pacific Ocean alone. Japanese fleets of the whalers even advanced into the Antarctic Ocean. 
					
					Whales Japan catches every year allegedly for scientific research total nearly 1,000.
					
					 Their illegal hunting has put the remaining species of whales in danger of extermination in the world.
					
					 An international organization concerned decided to prohibit all whaling fishing for commercial purpose, not research purpose, in 1986 in order to prevent the extermination of whales.
					
					 Ignoring the decision, however, Japan has refused to stop catching whales just for commercial profit.
					
					 The profit-seekers, accompanied by canning factory ships, have captured whales at random and packed their pieces to market them in Japan.
					
					 Whale meat is very expensive in shops, markets and restaurants throughout Japan and whalebones turn into high-grade craftworks.
					
					 Enormous is Japan's profits from the whale marketing.
					
					 It is natural that Japan is criticized by the international community for killing whales to rake in money.

articles.title: Japanese Imperialists' Land Pillage Censured
articles.content:
Japanese Imperialists' Land Pillage Censured
Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Land pillage, one of the hideous crimes the Japanese imperialists committed after their illegal occupation of Korea, caused untold sufferings to the Korean nation.
					 In 1906 the Japanese imperialists drafted "regulations on certification of lands and dwellings" to freely plunder Korea of its lands and establish a legal order.
					
					 On this basis they worked out "regulations on certification of land and real estate" in defence of the landownership of the Japanese residents, thus helping them own lands by law.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists also promulgated "regulations on land and real estate" in November 1906 and "regulations on mortgage execution of land and real estate" in 1907 with an aim to exercise the exclusive right to the transfer of the landownership in Korea. This provided a legal condition for the Japanese usurers and bankers to gain even the landownership through usury.
					
					 The land pillage was intensified under the pretext of "land investigation" entering in the 1910s.
					
					 The Japanese promulgated the "Land Survey Act" in August 1912 in which the land tenure relations previously recognized by the Korean feudal government were declared null and void and only those "approved" by them after being "declared" were pronounced as "legally valid".
					
					 The Japanese imperialists resorted to not only public ways but also various deceptive means to plunder lands.
					
					 The lands they usurped from Korean peasants through the investigation totaled over million hectares.
					
					 In 1921 Japanese landowners accounted for 54 percent among big landowners with more than 100 hectares, an increase from 20 percent in 1911.
					
					 The massive land pillage by the Japanese imperialists through all kinds of colonial evil laws forced the Korean peasants to suffer from severe hunger and poverty.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists should be made to pay to the Korean people for all the generations to come for those hideous crimes.

articles.title: Japan's Past Crimes Disclosed--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japan's Past Crimes Disclosed--Rodong Sinmun 
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- February 1, 1906, was the day when the Japanese imperialists set up the "residence-general", machinery for cruel colonial rule, in Korea. 
					 In this regard, Rodong Sinmun, a major newspaper of the DPRK, Tuesday carries a bylined article disclosing Japan's past crimes.
					
					 The establishment of "residence-general" and the rule by "resident-general" were, in essence, an open colonial fascist rule that wantonly violated the sovereignty and dignity of Korea, the article says. 
					
					 Citing facts to prove that the Korean people suffered huge human and material loss from the rule by the "resident-general", it says: 
					
					The Japanese imperialists killed more than one million Koreans and reduced 200,000 Korean women into sexual slaves over the 40 odd years of ferocious colonial and fascist rule over Korea including the period of the "resident-general" rule. And they plundered at random a lot of natural resources and cultural properties.
					
					 Japan is the assailant that imposed tremendous damage upon the Korean people. It is moral obligation and international usage for an assailant to make an apology and reparation to its victim. 
					
					 The Korean people hope that Japan will redeem all its past crimes and put an end to the abnormal relations with the DPRK as early as possible. To improve the bilateral relations depends entirely on Japan's settlement of the past. 
					
					 Japan should face up to the present reality and settle its disgraceful past at an early date. It will be good for Japan itself.

articles.title: Inter-Korean Reconciliation and Unity Called for-- Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Inter-Korean Reconciliation and Unity Called for-- Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Koreans from all walks of life in the north and the south and abroad should vigorously turn out in the sacred struggle for peace, reunification and prosperity by pooling their efforts and uniting with each other in patriotism, said Rodong Sinmun in a bylined article Tuesday.
					 The Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea released an appeal in the wake of the DPRK joint statement of government, political parties and organizations and the goodwill measures taken to implement it. This appeal is arousing all Koreans to the sacred struggle for tiding over the present grave difficulties and open up a turning phase for independent reunification, the article noted.
					
					 Stressing that all the patriotic-minded Koreans, whether they be authorities or civilians, should join efforts irrespective of differing ideologies and systems and open a turning phase for independent reunification, peace and prosperity, it said:
					
					 This is the most pressing task facing all Koreans.
					
					 Dialogue and negotiations are the only way for averting war and confrontation and improving the north-south relations.
					
					 They serve as the way for hewing out the destiny of the nation. This is proven by the valuable experience gained in the June 15 era of reunification in which the Korean nation had opened the road for independent reunification, peace and prosperity by its concerted efforts. It is also evidenced by the serious lesson taught by the last three years of north-south relations woven with frustration and crisis in vicious circle of confrontation.
					
					 What is decisive of north-south dialogue is dialogue between their authorities having power and responsibility.
					
					 Most of many important affairs vital to the nation can be settled by the authorities.
					
					 Bilateral and multilateral negotiations should be conducted in a positive way between politicians in the north and the south.
					
					 Any politician in Korea should sincerely work for the sake of the nation regardless of class, stratum and partisan interests.

articles.title: Struggle for Korea's Reunification Called for
articles.content:
Struggle for Korea's Reunification Called for
						
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions announced its action plan for this year at a meeting in Seoul on Jan. 27.
					 A resolution was read out at the meeting. It said that they would launch a vigorous action to defuse the danger of a war, ensure peace on the Korean Peninsula and achieve the independent reunification of the country.
					
					 The participants watched a video exposing the reactionary nature of the authorities' evil law on labor and showing the struggle of workers against poor labor conditions and unwarranted dismissal.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated in China
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated in China
						
Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A meeting and reception took place in Beijing on January 29 on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. They were co-sponsored by the China Association for International Friendly Contact and the Beijing Association for International Friendly Contact.
					 Present there were officials of the two organizations, personages of different strata, families of those who are related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle and veterans of the Chinese People's Volunteers.
					
					 The ambassador and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Beijing were present there on invitation. 
					
					 Li Xiaohua, vice-president of the China Association for International Friendly Contact, said that Kim Jong Il's reelection as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea at its Conference was an event of specially significance in accomplishing the cause of the Korean revolution and developing the Sino-DPRK friendship.
					
					 Praising Kim Jong Il for his immortal exploits for the development of the Sino-DPRK friendship through his two visits to China last year, the vice president expressed the belief that the friendship would further develop under the concern of the leaders of the two countries this year, too. 
					
					 Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, said that the stability and invincibility of the friendly relations between the two countries have been fully displayed last year.
					
					 He noted that the Korean people would make positive efforts to further develop the traditional DPRK-China friendship with the Chinese comrades this year marking the 50th anniversary of the conclusion of the DPRK-China Treaty of Friendship, Cooperation and Mutual Assistance. 
					
					 A performance was given by Chinese artistes.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised in Indonesia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised in Indonesia
						
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il has wisely led the army and the people of the DPRK to victory and glory with his Songun politics. Thus the Korean people are daily making fresh leap forward and innovations in the drive to build a thriving nation.
					 Ristiyanto, general secretary of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia, said this in a statement on January 26 on the occasion of the birthday of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The statement expressed belief that under the distinguished Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il the Korean people would bring about a decisive turn in the improvement of the people's living standard by accelerating the development of light industry once again and achieve success in the struggle for independent and peaceful reunification of the country in hearty response to the joint New Year editorial.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Carried by Nepalese Paper
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Carried by Nepalese Paper
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Nepalese newspaper Sremik carried President Kim Il Sung's reminiscences "With the Century" on Jan. 25.
					 It printed the full text of "Greeting the Spring in a Foreign Land" in Chapter 23 from Vol. 8 (continuing edition) of Part 1 The Anti-Japanese Revolution of the reminiscences.
					
					 The paper carried a picture of the President and Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero.

articles.title: DPRK Joint New Year Editorial Introduced Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK Joint New Year Editorial Introduced Abroad
						
Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The joint New Year editorial of the DPRK has been widely disseminated in more than 100 countries and regions.
					 Media which reported about the joint editorial included Xinhua News of China, ITAR-TASS of Russia, Prensa Latina News of Cuba, Islamic Republic News of Iran, AP of the United States, Syria's newspaper Al Baath and BBC of the UK. 
					
					 Political parties and organizations of different countries and regional and international bodies introduced the editorial through Internet homepages and bulletins. Among them were the Brazilian Communist Party, the Peruvian Communist Party, the Poland-DPRK Association, the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea and the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain. 
					
					 Seminars, lectures and reading sessions took place in Pakistan, Sweden, South Africa, Mexico and other countries to study and disseminate the editorial.
					
					 Political parties and organizations of at least 70 countries released statements expressing full support for the editorial.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					The January 25th issue of Guinean paper Horoya devoted one whole page to a special write-up carrying a photograph of Kim Jong Il watching vinalon cotton during his visit to the February 8 Vinalon Complex. 
					
					The paper in an article titled "Kim Jong Il, great leader of the Korean people" said that he has regarded even his birthday as an ordinary work day and devoted his all to the people.
					
					He has conducted the forced march giving tireless on-the-spot guidance to build a thriving socialist nation where people live with nothing more to desire as early as possible, the article added. 
					
					The Myanmar paper The Voice on January 24 carried a photograph of Kim Jong Il with an article titled "Kim Jong Il, man revered by people".
					
					The Pakistani paper Baluchistan Times on January 23 carried an article titled "Kim Jong Il, statesman of trust".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia la funcion de la unidad combinada 324 del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia la funcion de la unidad combinada 324 del EPC
 Pyongyang, 1 de febrero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, presencio la funcion del grupo de propaganda artistica de la gran unidad combinada 324 del EPC.
					  Los ejecutantes pusieron en la escena el quinteto femenino "Gloria a nuestro gran partido", el solo femenino y pangchang  "Encanto y veneracion" y otras piezas de diferentes generos.
					
					  A traves de la funcion, ellos demostraron bien la invencible potencia del ejercito revolucionario del monte Paektu crecido bajo la guia del gran general insigne como el capaz de aniquilar a cualesquier enemigos, la firme conviccion y voluntad de los militares del EPC de cumplir hasta el final con las armas la causa revolucionaria del Juche iniciada en la selva del monte Paektu.
					
					  Comprobaron la justeza y la vitalidad de la orientacion de nuestro partido sobre la propaganda artistica al estilo de guerrilla antijaponesa manifestando sin reserva el entusiasmo y el impetu con que llamaban a los militares a la lucha y a los meritos realizando la propaganda y agitacion al pie de trincheras, campos de entrenamiento y de construccion.
					
					  Ademas, demostraron claramente el poderio del grupo artistico militar que siembra en el corazon de los militares el ardiente amor al partido, al lider, a la patria y al pueblo cumpliendo magnificamente la sagrada mision de trompetero de la epoca del Songun.
					
					  El Dirigente evaluo altamente la exitosa funcion de los miembros del grupo de propaganda artistica y les expreso agradecimiento mostrandose muy satisfecho de que ellos hayan ofrecido esa magnifica funcion con las obras de gran valor cognoscitivo y educativo que reflejan sincera y vividamente el inagotable espiritu, nobles virtudes y la vida de servicio militar de los uniformados del EPC.
					
					  Senalando que es muy importante la propaganda artistica en la educacion ideologica porque conmueve y llama fuertemente a los militares, presento las tareas para intensificar esa labor de caracter revolucionario y combativo.
					
					  Disfrutaron tambien la funcion Kim Ki Nam y Hong Sok Hyong, miembros del Buro Politico y secretarios del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Thae Jong Su, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del BP y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Hyon Chol Hae y Ri Myong Su, miembros del CC del PTC y generales de ejercito del EPC, y otros comandantes del ejercito.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige la Fabrica de Maquinaria de Sinhung
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige la Fabrica de Maquinaria de Sinhung
						
Pyongyang, 1 de febrero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno la Fabrica de Maquinaria de Sinhung.
					  Tras escuchar las explicaciones sobre la perspectiva de produccion de la fabrica, recorrio varios talleres para enterarse en detalles del estado de renovacion tecnica y produccion. 
					
					  Al averiguar concretamente las estructuras, las especificaciones y los principios de funcionamiento de las maquinas recien fabricadas, se mostro muy satisfecho de que los funcionarios, obreros y tecnicos de la fabrica hayan producido, uniendo su inteligencia creativa, muchas maquinas modernas que contribuiran a la construccion de la potencia economica.
					
					  Los obreros de la fabrica hicieron gran contribucion a la realizacion de la causa de construccion de la gran potencia prospera socialista al producir y suministrar muchas maquinas modernas a varias ramas de economia nacional, dijo y evaluo de altos sus meritos. 
					
					  Se reunio con la gemela Pak Chun Nam y Pak Chun Sun, con quienes se habia encontrado hace mas de 20 anos en el mismo lugar de produccion, y les pregunto con carino como trabajan y viven. Y aprecio mucho a ellas que desde que eran muchachas, trabajan hasta la fecha con ardiente pasion y patriotismo por la prosperidad de la patria. 
					
					  Al escuchar el parte de los funcionarios directivos de la fabrica de que la operacion exitosa de esta se debe tambien a los esfuerzos abnegados de los miembros del grupo directivo, que marcha al frente compartiendo las penas con los obreros en los talleres de produccion, expreso su gran satisfaccion y recalco que los funcionarios deben apoyar las politicas del partido y materializarlas a cabalidad en la practica. 
					
					  El Dirigente indico las tareas que incumben a la fabrica. 
					
					  La tarea mas importante es aumentar bruscamente la produccion de nuevos productos, subrayo. 
					
					  Encomendo encarecidamente que prestaran profunda atencion a la intendencia y suministro a los obreros, teniendo presente las instrucciones del Presidente Kim Il Sung de que "la intendencia es precisamente una labor politica", y tomo unas medidas benevolas para los obreros de la fabrica. 
					
					  Exhorto a glorificar cada momento de la epoca de gran auge con el gran proposito, el noble ideal, el coraje y el optimismo del Presidente, el indoblegable temperamento de hacer lo imposible para otros, la audacia de crear todas las cosas sorprendiendo al mundo y el modo de trabajo revolucionario de terminar todas las obras a perfeccion para que las generaciones venideras se beneficien de ellas. 
					
					  Expreso gran esperanza y conviccion de que en lo adelante tambien, los obreros de la fabrica cumpliran el papel de vanguardia en la construccion de la gran potencia prospera socialista. 
					
					  Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Kim Ki Nam y Hong Sok Hyong, miembros del Buro Politico y secretarios del Comite Central del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Thae Jong Su, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC, Hyon Chol Hae y Ri Myong Su, jefes de departamento del CDN, y Kwak Pom Gi, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Sur.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela crimenes de Japon durante ocupacion de Corea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela crimenes de Japon durante ocupacion de Corea
						
 Pyongyang, 1 de febrero (ATCC) -- El primero de febrero de 1906, los imperialistas japoneses instalaron en Corea la oficina de "gobernador general", aparato de dominacion colonial.
					  El coloniaje japones mediante el "gobernador general" violo flagrantemente la soberania y la dignidad de Corea. 
					
					  Senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual de este martes y revela con datos las enormes perdidas humanas y materiales del pueblo coreano sufridas bajo la dominacion de "gobernador general". 
					
					  Durante mas de 40 anos de colonialismo incluyendo el periodo de ese sistema de gobernacion, los imperialistas japoneses asesinaron a mas de un millon de coreanos, convirtieron a 200 mil coreanas en esclavas sexuales y saquearon enormes recursos naturales y patrimonios culturales de Corea. 
					
					  El culpable debe pedir disculpas e indemnizar a la victima. Esto es la obligacion moral y costumbre internacional. 
					
					  El pueblo coreano desea que Japon liquide cuanto antes todos sus crimenes del pasado justipreciando la realidad y ponga punto final a las relaciones anormales con Corea. 
					
					  La mejora de las relaciones entre Corea y Japon depende enteramente de la liquidacion del pasado por el segundo.
					
					Esto convendria tambien a Japon.

articles.title: Criticado Japon por la pesca ilicita de ballenas
articles.content:
Criticado Japon por la pesca ilicita de ballenas
Pyongyang, 1 de febrero (ATCC) -- Es una polemica mundial la ilegal pesca de barcos balleneros japoneses.
					  Estas naves siguen matando las ballenas protegidas internacionalmente en el Oceano Pacifico, el Indico y el Atlantico y hasta en el mar del polo sur.
					
					  En los ultimos anos, llegaron a mil los balleneros japoneses solo en el Pacifico y sobrepasaron 100 mil los hombres que se dedican a la caza de cetaceos.
					
					  Bajo el pretexto de "investigacion cientifica", ellos pescan anualmente mil ballenas aproximadamente en el mar del polo sur, el Pacifico del Norte, etc.
					
					  Ante el inminente peligro de extincion, en 1986, una organizacion internacional concerniente decidio prohibir toda la pesca con fines comerciales, salvo los objetivos de estudio.
					
					  Sin embargo, los cazadores japoneses avanzan a la alta mar hasta con barco-fabrica para procesar en el acto la ballena pescada en conservas y ganar sumas fabulosas distribuyendolas a los mercados nacionales.
					
					  La carne de ballena se vende cara en las tiendas, mercados y restaurantes a lo largo de Japon y su hueso resulta otra fuente de ingreso siendo materia prima de artesania.
					
					  El procedimiento irrazonable de Japon para acabar con ese precioso recurso biologico de la humanidad merece la critica y repudio de la sociedad internacional.
